question.title: copy the contents of an array to another and deleting the contents of the old array

node.contents: There are few in-built methods as well as libraries to copy contents of an array. May be you can try to use that. Please check Collection Framework and also search for libraries on the net.

astNode.text: There are few in-built methods as well as libraries to copy contents of an array. May be you can try to use that. Please check Collection Framework and also search for libraries on the net.

node.contents: I am trying to copy the contents of an array to another array after a button is clicked. I want the oldArray to be cleared of the previous data after it is copied to newArray. I have this code and I'm lost. can anyone please guide me on how to do this? here's what I have so far.

astNode.text: I am trying to copy the contents of an array to another array after a button is clicked. I want the oldArray to be cleared of the previous data after it is copied to newArray. I have this code and I'm lost. can anyone please guide me on how to do this? here's what I have so far.

elements.contents: final String [] oldArray; oldArray = new String[5]; oldArray[0] = "c"; oldArray[1] = "h"; oldArray[2] = "a"; oldArray[3] = "r"; oldArray[4] = "m"; for (i = 0; i < 5; i++); { oldarrayOut.setText(oldArray[i]); } bOk.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() { @Override public void onClick(View v) { // TODO Auto-generated method stub String[] newArray = new String[5]; for (i = 0; i < 5; i++); { newArray[i] = oldArray[i]; newarrayOut.setText(newArray[i]); } } });

comments.text: // TODO Auto-generated method stub String[] newArray = new String[5]; for (i = 0; i < 5; i++); { newArray[i] = oldArray[i]; newarrayOut.setText(newArray[i]); } } });

node.contents: please feel free to notify me also if there's something wrong in my code. Thank you very much!

astNode.text: please feel free to notify me also if there's something wrong in my code. Thank you very much!

node.contents: That doesn't clear the array. If some other object has a reference to the old array, it still sees the old values.

astNode.text: That doesn't clear the array. If some other object has a reference to the old array, it still sees the old values.

node.contents: You are right. But as I understand, this is what he wants.

astNode.text: You are right. But as I understand, this is what he wants.

node.contents: So the old array wont point to the really old array, but to a new one.

astNode.text: So the old array wont point to the really old array, but to a new one.

node.contents: The first one is better if you know you're gonna use it again, and you know the length of the array. The other need to be treated safe as it may cause NPE if you access it.

astNode.text: The first one is better if you know you're gonna use it again, and you know the length of the array. The other need to be treated safe as it may cause NPE if you access it.

node.contents: outside the for loop in your onClick method would do it.

astNode.text: outside the for loop in your onClick method would do it.

node.contents: You seem to be copying the array successfully, just not initializing oldArray once you've finished copying.

astNode.text: You seem to be copying the array successfully, just not initializing oldArray once you've finished copying.

node.contents: You have a semicolon after the for loop:

astNode.text: You have a semicolon after the for loop:

node.contents: Which transforms the for loop into a loop doing nothing at each iteration. Remove it.

astNode.text: Which transforms the for loop into a loop doing nothing at each iteration. Remove it.
